doc:
Daisy and Violet Hilton https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daisy_and_Violet_Hilton 0 Daisy and Violet Hilton (5 February 1908 – 4 January 1969) were English entertainers, who were conjoined twins. They were exhibited in Europe as children, and toured the United States sideshow, vaudeville and American burlesque circuits in the 1920s and 1930s. They were best known for their film appearances in Freaks and Chained for Life. The twins were born at 18 Riley Road, Brighton, England, on 5 February 1908. Their mother was Kate Skinner, an unmarried barmaid. The sisters were born joined by their hips and buttocks; they shared blood circulation and were fused at the pelvis but shared no major organs. They were variously called or referred to as The Siamese Twins, The Hilton Sisters and The Brighton Twins or The Brighton Conjoined Twins. Daisy_and_Violet_Hilton ( 5_February_1908 – 4_January_1969 ) were English_entertainers , who were_conjoined twins . They were_exhibited in Europe as children , and toured the_United_States_sideshow_,_vaudeville_and_American_burlesque_circuits in the_1920s_and_1930s . They were_best_known for their_film_appearances in Freaks_and_Chained for Life . The_twins were_born at 18_Riley_Road , Brighton , England , on 5_February_1908 . Their_mother was Kate_Skinner , an_unmarried_barmaid . The_sisters were_born_joined by their_hips_and_buttocks ; they shared blood_circulation and were_fused at the_pelvis but shared no_major_organs . They were_variously_called_or_referred to as The_Siamese_Twins , The_Hilton_Sisters and The_Brighton_Twins or The_Brighton_Conjoined_Twins .
